info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 14 at 9:49PM EDT until May 15 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northern Indiana, including the following county, Allen IN.
* WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 947 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. While amounts vary greatly, radar estimates that 1 to over 2 inches of rain has fallen, with the highest amounts likely near and north of Hoagland. - While a slow diminishing trend in the storms is expected through 11 PM EDT, additional rainfall amounts of locally up to an inch could call. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monroeville, Middletown, Hoagland, Hessen Cassel and Poe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT THURSDAY
